Description: Study of accounting principles for managers to plan, control, and analyze operations.
Overview of business structures, management, and organizational theory.
Methods and tools for managing production and business processes efficiently.
Advanced topics in defining, analyzing, and implementing business strategies.
Foundation of chemical principles and reactions, designed for science majors.
Structure, properties, and reactions of organic compounds.
Basics of programming using modern languages for problem-solving.
Core structures (lists, trees) and algorithms for computation and software development.
Concepts and implementation of databases including SQL and data modeling.
Introduction to consumer and producer behavior, and market dynamics.
Study of aggregate economic variables: GDP, inflation, unemployment, and policies.
Fundamentals of company finance: budgeting, valuation, and raising capital.
Basics of stocks, bonds, and financial institutions and their operations.
Techniques for evaluating investment opportunities, risks, and returns.
In-depth analysis of financial strategy, M&A, and corporate governance.
Principles for effective hiring, training, and retaining employees.
Strategies and managerial practices for global operations.
Fundamental concepts in planning, pricing, and promotion of products/services.
Analysis of factors influencing individual and group buying decisions.
Methods and tools for gathering and analyzing market data.
Differentiation and integration of functions, limits, and introductory analysis.
Vector spaces, matrices, and linear transformations underpinning technical fields.
Techniques for solving ordinary differential equations and applications.
Newtonian mechanics, motion, forces, and energy concepts.
Study of electric and magnetic fields and their interactions.
Principles of quantum systems, wave functions, and uncertainty.
Analysis and interpretation of data with probability and statistical methods.
